definition: "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
extent of a rise (in prices etc)/amount of increase/growth (typically expressed as a percentage)
to appreciate (in value)/to increase in price
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
bull market (prices appear to be rising)
the tide rises, the boat floats (idiom); fig. to change with the overall trend/to develop according to the situation
(of water) to soar/(of prices) to skyrocket
(of water, prices etc) to rise and fall
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)

sentences.english: This is up to request the form, the results are not up.
sentences.chinese: 这就是形态上要求上涨，结果不涨。

sentences.english: The Premier announces that state-run petroleum company will raise gasoline prices from midnight.
sentences.chinese: 总理宣布，国营石油公司将从午夜起调涨汽油价格。

sentences.english: Grain prices have pushed up by 15% year-on-year.
sentences.chinese: 粮食价格比去年同期涨了15%。

sentences.english: The waters were rising about the rock and would soon submerge it.
sentences.chinese: 水快涨到跟岩石一样高了，很快就会淹没它。

sentences.english: My salary rose substantially over the years.
sentences.chinese: 我的薪水在这些年里涨了很多。

sentences.english: A 70-fold increase in speed for a sevenfold increase in price would seem a bargain.
sentences.chinese: 速度增加70倍，价格才涨了7倍，似乎很划得来。

sentences.english: However, last week I noticed there price went up to RMB 6.
sentences.chinese: 然而，上周，我发现烝饺的价格已经涨到六元了。

sentences.english: The water rose higher, so Jim climbed onto his roof.
sentences.chinese: 水涨还在涨高，吉姆爬上了屋顶。

sentences.english: Tinned meat and poultry is up 47%.
TSMC share prices skyrocketed to reach the ceiling price of 60 NT in mid-session.
sentences.chinese: 盘中台积电股价急拉大涨，一度冲高到60元涨停。

sentences.english: Polyester market rise in the overall stability of Jiangsu and Zhejiang, one to 200 per cent.
sentences.chinese: 江浙涤丝市场整体稳中有涨，涨幅多在一至两百。

sentences.english: He gained 17 lb. after only a week in the Americans' care.
sentences.chinese: 在美国人的照料下，一周过去他就涨了17磅。

sentences.english: According to introducing, yesterday cupreous price by last year every tons more than 40000 go up to seventy thousand and two.
sentences.chinese: 据介绍，昨日铜价由去年的每吨四万多涨到七万二。

sentences.english: Wednesday, the price of gold topped $1,505 an ounce.
sentences.chinese: 星期三，黄金价格涨到每盎司1505美元。

sentences.english: But over time our studies indicate, stocks do go up and up.
sentences.chinese: 但是我们的研究标明，股票总体还是会一涨再涨的。

definition: to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]
extent of a rise (in prices etc)/amount of increase/growth (typically expressed as a percentage)
to fall back (of water level or share prices)
to appreciate (in value)/to increase in price
to receive mail/to receive a telegraph
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
